bibl.title: Albert B. Martin v. United States. Order Granting Writ.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington. Northern Division.
In the matter of the application of Arthur B. Martin, for Writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2852 Order Granting Writ

On reading and filing the petition of Arthur B. Martin, duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that he is illegally imprisioned and restrained from his liberty by the United States Commissioner of Immigration at the Detention Station in the City of Seattle, in said County, State of Washington, and stating wherein the illegality exists, from which it appears to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus ought to be issued;

It is Therefore Ordered That a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the United States of the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, directed to the said Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, commanding him to have the body of the said Arthur B. Martin before me in the Court Room of said Court on this first day of SeptemberOct 1914, at 2 o'clock p.m. of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Arthur B. Martin, together with the time and cause of his detention, and that he have then and there said Writ.
Dated in said District on the 24th day of September, 1914.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the matter of the application of Arthur B. Martin, for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the U.S. District Court Western Dist. of Washington Northern Division Sep 24 1914 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk. By EML Deputy
